condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children in humanitarian situations access child protection services.

description.narrative: Children in humanitarian need had increased access to UNICEF-supported services in 2017. 359,334 IDP and refugee children received psychosocial support to improve their well-being. Quality of specialized services has improved and reached 31,884 IDP and refugee children. 10,611 women and girls received multi-sectoral GBV services | Status:Discontinued | As-of Date:31/12/2017
